result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony K Bublitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay within 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony K Bublitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Anthony K Bublitz in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. Def waives counsel; enters NC plea. Court accepts waiver and plea; finds defendant guilty. ADA Sempf heard. Def makes statement. Court heard and imposes sentence:

Court costs within 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

Defendant, Anthony K Bublitz in court, Kevin Schmidt by James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Return date scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.
